meanings.definition: Carefully choosing only the best or most suitable options.
meanings.sent1: She is very selective when picking out clothes for special occasions.
meanings.sent2: The selective process for the school's elite program was rigorous.
meanings.sent3: Being selective about the ingredients, she created a delicious cake.
meanings.sent4: Her selective taste in music made her a sought-after DJ.
meanings.sent5: The selective process ensured only the top candidates were chosen.

meanings.definition: Involving the selection of a particular group or individual from a larger group.
meanings.sent1: The selective team consisted of the best players from different schools.
meanings.sent2: The selective admission policy aimed to bring diversity to the group.
meanings.sent3: The selective group of friends always had the best adventures together.
meanings.sent4: Her selective approach to hiring led to a strong and cohesive team.
meanings.sent5: The selective process ensured a fair representation of all members in the group.

meanings.definition: Tending to choose or be chosen carefully.
meanings.sent1: He has a selective memory, only remembering the good times.
meanings.sent2: The selective nature of the job required attention to detail.
meanings.sent3: The cat was very selective about who it allowed to pet it.
meanings.sent4: Her selective taste in books led her to discover hidden literary gems.
meanings.sent5: The selective process helped her find the perfect gift for her friend.
